result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (35 pages) commencing 05-31-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 years, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 74 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 1 year, the term of extended supervision is 3 years. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Maintain employment.
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Letters on behalf of defendant, filed

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

1343 Jury Instruction

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Turnover to JusticePoint for level 5 supervision. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney Paul K Kuszel in court, defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia not in court, in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail Hearing held via Zoom. State has no objection to Defense bail motion. Court orders cash bail amended to $100.00.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed

Defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia in court with Attorney Paul Kuszel; both appear by video.  Defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia in court with attorney Paul K Kuszel.  Defendant Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis Miguel Lopez Mejia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019685,
Payable Number: 988889,
Receipt Number: 22RP008307,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
